00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.

00036  * lustre/utils/lr_reader.c
00037  *
00038  * Author: Nathan Rutman <nathan@clusterfs.com>

00040  /* Safely read the last_rcvd file from a device */
00041 
00042 #if HAVE_CONFIG_H
00043 #  include "config.h"
00044 #endif /* HAVE_CONFIG_H */
00045 
00046 #ifndef _GNU_SOURCE
00047 #define _GNU_SOURCE
00048 #endif
00049 #include <errno.h>
00050 #include <limits.h>
00051 #include <stdbool.h>
00052 #include <stdlib.h>
00053 #include <stdio.h>
00054 #include <unistd.h>
00055 #include <fcntl.h>
00056 #include <stdarg.h>
00057 #include <mntent.h>
00058 
00059 #include <sys/types.h>
00060 #include <sys/stat.h>
00061 #include <sys/mount.h>
00062 
00063 #include <string.h>
00064 #include <getopt.h>
00065 
00066 #include <lustre_disk.h>
00067 #include <lustre_ver.h>
00068 
00069 char *progname;
00070 static struct option const longopts[] = {
00071         { "help", no_argument, 0, 'h' },
00072         { "client", no_argument, 0, 'c' },
00073         { "reply", no_argument, 0, 'r' },
00074         { 0, 0, 0, 0}
00075 };
00076 
00077 /* Executes the command \a cmd and returns command status.
00078  */
00079 int run_command(char *cmd, size_t cmdsz)
00080 {
00081         char log[] = "/tmp/run_command_logXXXXXX";
00082         int fd, rc;
00083 
00084         if (strlen(cmd) + strlen(log) + 8 > cmdsz) {
00085                 fprintf(stderr, "Command buffer overflow: %.*s...\n",
00086                         (int)cmdsz, cmd);
00087                 return -ENOMEM;
00088         }
00089 
00090         fd = mkstemp(log);
00091         if (fd >= 0) {
00092                 close(fd);
00093                 strncat(cmd, " >", 2);
00094                 strncat(cmd, log, strlen(log));
00095         }
00096         strncat(cmd, " 2>&1", 5);
00097 
00098         /* Can't use popen because we need the rv of the command */
00099         rc = system(cmd);
00100         if (rc && fd >= 0) {
00101                 char buf[128];
00102                 FILE *fp;
00103                 fp = fopen(log, "r");
00104                 if (fp) {
00105                         while (fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), fp) != NULL) {
00106                                 if (rc)
00107                                         printf("   %s", buf);
00108                         }
00109                         fclose(fp);
00110                 }
00111         }
00112         if (fd >= 0)
00113                 remove(log);
00114         return rc;
00115 }
00116 
00117 
00118 void display_usage(void)
00119 {
00120         printf("Usage: %s [OPTIONS] devicename\n", progname);
00121         printf("Read and print the last_rcvd file from a device\n");
00122         printf("(safe for mounted devices)\n");
00123         printf("\t-c, --client, display client information\n");
00124         printf("\t-h, --help,   display this help and exit\n");
00125         printf("\t-r, --reply,  display reply data information\n");
00126 }
00127 
00128 
00129 int main(int argc, char *const argv[])
00130 {
00131         char tmpdir[] = "/tmp/dirXXXXXX";
00132         char cmd[128];
00133         char filepnm[128] = "";
00134         char *dev;
00135         struct lr_server_data lsd;
00136         FILE *filep = NULL;
00137         int ret;
00138         int c;
00139         int opt_client = 0;
00140         int opt_reply = 0;
00141 
00142         progname = argv[0];
00143         while ((c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "chr", longopts, NULL)) != -1) {
00144                 switch (c) {
00145                 case 'c':
00146                         opt_client = 1;
00147                         break;
00148                 case 'r':
00149                         opt_reply = 1;
00150                         break;
00151                 case 'h':
00152                 default:
00153                         display_usage();
00154                         return -1;
00155                 }
00156         }
00157         dev = argv[optind];
00158         if (!dev) {
00159                 display_usage();
00160                 return -1;
00161         }
00162 
00163         /* Make a temporary directory to hold Lustre data files. */
00164         if (!mkdtemp(tmpdir)) {
00165                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Can't create temporary directory %s: %s\n",
00166                         progname, tmpdir, strerror(errno));
00167                 return errno;
00168         }
00169 
00170         memset(cmd, 0, sizeof(cmd));
00171         snprintf(cmd, sizeof(cmd),
00172                 "%s -c -R 'dump /%s %s/%s' %s",
00173                 DEBUGFS, LAST_RCVD, tmpdir, LAST_RCVD, dev);
00174 
00175         ret = run_command(cmd, sizeof(cmd));
00176         if (ret) {
00177                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to dump %s file\n",
00178                         progname, LAST_RCVD);
00179                 goto out_rmdir;
00180         }
00181 
00182         snprintf(filepnm, 128, "%s/%s", tmpdir, LAST_RCVD);
00183         filep = fopen(filepnm, "r");
00184         if (!filep) {
00185                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to read old data\n",
00186                         progname);
00187                 ret = -errno;
00188                 goto out_rmdir;
00189         }
00190         unlink(filepnm);
00191 
00192         /* read lr_server_data structure */
00193         printf("%s:\n", LAST_RCVD);
00194         ret = fread(&lsd, 1, sizeof(lsd), filep);
00195         if (ret < sizeof(lsd)) {
00196                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Short read (%d of %d)\n",
00197                         progname, ret, (int)sizeof(lsd));
00198                 ret = -ferror(filep);
00199                 if (ret)
00200                         goto out_close;
00201         }
00202 
00203         /* swab structure fields of interest */
00204         lsd.lsd_feature_compat = le32_to_cpu(lsd.lsd_feature_compat);
00205         lsd.lsd_feature_incompat = le32_to_cpu(lsd.lsd_feature_incompat);
00206         lsd.lsd_feature_rocompat = le32_to_cpu(lsd.lsd_feature_rocompat);
00207         lsd.lsd_last_transno = le64_to_cpu(lsd.lsd_last_transno);
00208         lsd.lsd_osd_index = le32_to_cpu(lsd.lsd_osd_index);
00209         lsd.lsd_mount_count = le64_to_cpu(lsd.lsd_mount_count);
00210 
00211         /* display */
00212         printf("  uuid: %.40s\n", lsd.lsd_uuid);
00213         printf("  feature_compat: %#x\n", lsd.lsd_feature_compat);
00214         printf("  feature_incompat: %#x\n", lsd.lsd_feature_incompat);
00215         printf("  feature_rocompat: %#x\n", lsd.lsd_feature_rocompat);
00216         printf("  last_transaction: %llu\n", lsd.lsd_last_transno);
00217         printf("  target_index: %u\n", lsd.lsd_osd_index);
00218         printf("  mount_count: %llu\n", lsd.lsd_mount_count);
00219 
00220         /* read client information */
00221         if (opt_client) {
00222                 lsd.lsd_client_start = le32_to_cpu(lsd.lsd_client_start);
00223                 lsd.lsd_client_size = le16_to_cpu(lsd.lsd_client_size);
00224                 printf("  client_area_start: %u\n", lsd.lsd_client_start);
00225                 printf("  client_area_size: %hu\n", lsd.lsd_client_size);
00226 
00227                 /* seek to per-client data area */
00228                 ret = fseek(filep, lsd.lsd_client_start, SEEK_SET);
00229                 if (ret) {
00230                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: seek failed. %s\n",
00231                                 progname, strerror(errno));
00232                         ret = errno;
00233                         goto out_close;
00234                 }
00235 
00236                 /* walk throuh the per-client data area */
00237                 while (true) {
00238                         struct lsd_client_data lcd;
00239 
00240                         /* read a per-client data area */
00241                         ret = fread(&lcd, 1, sizeof(lcd), filep);
00242                         if (ret < sizeof(lcd)) {
00243                                 if (feof(filep))
00244                                         break;
00245                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Short read (%d of %d)\n",
00246                                         progname, ret, (int)sizeof(lcd));
00247                                 ret = -ferror(filep);
00248                                 goto out_close;
00249                         }
00250 
00251                         if (lcd.lcd_uuid[0] == '\0')
00252                                 continue;
00253 
00254                         /* swab structure fields */
00255                         lcd.lcd_last_transno =
00256                                         le64_to_cpu(lcd.lcd_last_transno);
00257                         lcd.lcd_last_xid = le64_to_cpu(lcd.lcd_last_xid);
00258                         lcd.lcd_last_result = le32_to_cpu(lcd.lcd_last_result);
00259                         lcd.lcd_last_data = le32_to_cpu(lcd.lcd_last_data);
00260                         lcd.lcd_generation = le32_to_cpu(lcd.lcd_generation);
00261 
00262                         /* display per-client data area */
00263                         printf("\n  %.40s:\n", lcd.lcd_uuid);
00264                         printf("    generation: %u\n", lcd.lcd_generation);
00265                         printf("    last_transaction: %llu\n",
00266                                lcd.lcd_last_transno);
00267                         printf("    last_xid: %llu\n", lcd.lcd_last_xid);
00268                         printf("    last_result: %u\n", lcd.lcd_last_result);
00269                         printf("    last_data: %u\n", lcd.lcd_last_data);
00270 
00271                         if (lcd.lcd_last_close_transno != 0 &&
00272                             lcd.lcd_last_close_xid != 0) {
00273                                 lcd.lcd_last_close_transno =
00274                                         le64_to_cpu(lcd.lcd_last_close_transno);
00275                                 lcd.lcd_last_close_xid =
00276                                         le64_to_cpu(lcd.lcd_last_close_xid);
00277                                 lcd.lcd_last_close_result =
00278                                         le32_to_cpu(lcd.lcd_last_close_result);
00279                                 lcd.lcd_last_close_data =
00280                                         le32_to_cpu(lcd.lcd_last_close_data);
00281                                 printf("    last_close_transation: %llu\n",
00282                                        lcd.lcd_last_close_transno);
00283                                 printf("    last_close_xid: %llu\n",
00284                                        lcd.lcd_last_close_xid);
00285                                 printf("    last_close_result: %u\n",
00286                                        lcd.lcd_last_close_result);
00287                                 printf("    last_close_data: %u\n",
00288                                        lcd.lcd_last_close_data);
00289                         }
00290                 }
00291         }
00292         fclose(filep);
00293         filep = NULL;
00294 
00295         /* read reply data information */
00296         if (opt_reply) {
00297                 struct lsd_reply_header lrh;
00298                 struct lsd_reply_data lrd;
00299                 unsigned long long slot;
00300 
00301                 snprintf(cmd, sizeof(cmd),
00302                          "%s -c -R 'dump /%s %s/%s' %s",
00303                          DEBUGFS, REPLY_DATA, tmpdir, REPLY_DATA, dev);
00304 
00305                 ret = run_command(cmd, sizeof(cmd));
00306                 if (ret) {
00307                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to dump %s file\n",
00308                                 progname, REPLY_DATA);
00309                         goto out_rmdir;
00310                 }
00311 
00312                 snprintf(filepnm, sizeof(filepnm),
00313                          "%s/%s", tmpdir, REPLY_DATA);
00314                 filep = fopen(filepnm, "r");
00315                 if (!filep) {
00316                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to read reply data\n",
00317                                 progname);
00318                         ret = -errno;
00319                         goto out_rmdir;
00320                 }
00321                 unlink(filepnm);
00322 
00323                 /* read reply_data header */
00324                 printf("\n%s:\n", REPLY_DATA);
00325                 ret = fread(&lrh, 1, sizeof(lrh), filep);
00326                 if (ret < sizeof(lrh)) {
00327                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: Short read (%d of %d)\n",
00328                                 progname, ret, (int)sizeof(lrh));
00329                         ret = -ferror(filep);
00330                         if (ret)
00331                                 goto out_close;
00332                 }
00333 
00334                 /* check header */
00335                 lrh.lrh_magic = le32_to_cpu(lrh.lrh_magic);
00336                 lrh.lrh_header_size = le32_to_cpu(lrh.lrh_header_size);
00337                 lrh.lrh_reply_size = le32_to_cpu(lrh.lrh_reply_size);
00338                 if (lrh.lrh_magic != LRH_MAGIC) {
00339                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: invalid %s header: "
00340                                 "lrh_magic=%08x expected %08x\n",
00341                                 progname, REPLY_DATA, lrh.lrh_magic, LRH_MAGIC);
00342                         goto out_close;
00343                 }
00344                 if (lrh.lrh_header_size != sizeof(struct lsd_reply_header)) {
00345                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: invalid %s header: "
00346                                 "lrh_header_size=%08x expected %08x\n",
00347                                 progname, REPLY_DATA, lrh.lrh_header_size,
00348                                 (unsigned int)sizeof(struct lsd_reply_header));
00349                         goto out_close;
00350                 }
00351                 if (lrh.lrh_reply_size != sizeof(struct lsd_reply_data)) {
00352                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: invalid %s header: "
00353                                 "lrh_reply_size=%08x expected %08x\n",
00354                                 progname, REPLY_DATA, lrh.lrh_reply_size,
00355                                 (unsigned int)sizeof(struct lsd_reply_data));
00356                         goto out_close;
00357                 }
00358 
00359                 /* walk throuh the reply data */
00360                 for (slot = 0; ; slot++) {
00361                         /* read a reply data */
00362                         ret = fread(&lrd, 1, sizeof(lrd), filep);
00363                         if (ret < sizeof(lrd)) {
00364                                 if (feof(filep))
00365                                         break;
00366                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Short read (%d of %d)\n",
00367                                         progname, ret, (int)sizeof(lrd));
00368                                 ret = -ferror(filep);
00369                                 goto out_close;
00370                         }
00371 
00372                         /* display reply data */
00373                         lrd.lrd_transno = le64_to_cpu(lrd.lrd_transno);
00374                         lrd.lrd_xid = le64_to_cpu(lrd.lrd_xid);
00375                         lrd.lrd_data = le64_to_cpu(lrd.lrd_data);
00376                         lrd.lrd_result = le32_to_cpu(lrd.lrd_result);
00377                         lrd.lrd_client_gen = le32_to_cpu(lrd.lrd_client_gen);
00378 
00379                         printf("  %lld:\n", slot);
00380                         printf("    client_generation: %u\n",
00381                                lrd.lrd_client_gen);
00382                         printf("    last_transaction: %llu\n", lrd.lrd_transno);
00383                         printf("    last_xid: %llu\n", lrd.lrd_xid);
00384                         printf("    last_result: %u\n", lrd.lrd_result);
00385                         printf("    last_data: %llu\n\n", lrd.lrd_data);
00386                 }
00387         }
00388 
00389 out_close:
00390         if (filep != NULL)
00391                 fclose(filep);
00392 
00393 out_rmdir:
00394         rmdir(tmpdir);
00395         return ret;
00396 }
